DOC.brief_summary: RATIONALE : Patient-controlled analgesia use fentanyl bupivacaine may lessen pain caused video-assisted chest surgery . Giving bupivacaine different way may give good pain relief . PURPOSE : Thisrandomized clinical trial compare three different way give bupivacaine together fentanyl see well work reduce pain video-assisted chest surgery .
DOC.brief_title: Fentanyl With Without Bupivacaine Reducing Pain Patients Undergoing Video-Assisted Chest Surgery
DOC.detailed_description: OBJECTIVES : Primary - To compare efficacy intravenous , patient-controlled , narcotic pain management alone efficacy intermittent bolus injection bupivacaine hydrochloride via intrapleural catheter patient successfully undergone video-assisted thoracic surgery ( VATS ) . Secondary - To compare efficacy intermittent bolus administration bupivacaine hydrochloride efficacy continuous bupivacaine hydrochloride administration via intrapleural catheter patient successfully undergone VATS . - To compare visual analog scale pain score measurement time . - To compare patient satisfaction score method pain control . - To compare rate conversion bolus delivery intravenous narcotic delivery . - To compare rate conversion continuous intrapleural infusion bolus delivery intravenous narcotic delivery alone . - To compare total amount narcotic use bolus intrapleural delivery continuous intrapleural infusion . OUTLINE : Patients randomize 1 3 treatment arm . - Arm I : Patients receive intravenous patient-controlled analgesia ( IV-PCA ) fentanyl citrate begin patient awake alert surgery continue 24 hour . - Arm II : Patients receive intermittent intrapleural bolus bupivacaine hydrochloride immediately surgery 6 , 12 , 18 , 24 hour surgery IV-PCA fentanyl citrate arm I . - Arm III : Patients receive continuous infusion intrapleural bupivacaine hydrochloride begin immediately surgery continue 24 hour IV-PCA fentanyl citrate arm I . In arm , visual analog scale measurement take baseline 6 , 12 , 18 , 24 hour post-surgery . After 24 hour , 5-point Likert scale survey administer assess overall patient satisfaction pain control 24-hour postoperative period .
